title: What is The Writing Cooperative?

About the Writing Cooperative

What is The Writing Cooperative?

We’re not just a publication or a Patreon. We help each other write better in a number of different ways.

Justin Cox 🍩
Nov 12, 2018

These links work best when viewed in a browser.

  1. Publication
  2. Free Slack Community
  3. Writing Challenges
  4. Support Us
  5. Our Team

Our publication serves 800k page views a month and more than 15k unique visitors every day. We add new contributors (writers) a few times each month. We are the 20th largest active publication on Medium with over 150k followers and roughly 2,000 contributors.

Everything we publish falls within our mission statement: Helping each other write better. There are two types of articles: those offered freely to the public and those available to members of Medium. Articles published for Medium members allow our writers to earn money for their writing through Medium’s Partner Program.

Some articles authored by our Administrative Team (Jessica Jungton, Justin Cox, Sand Farnia, and Stella J. McKenna) may contain affiliate marketing links. This means some of the services and products listed in these stories pay us referral fees when new users sign up for their service or product. These affiliate relationships help provide support to our administrative team to keep The Writing Cooperative operating.

Opinions presented in our publication are those of the individual author credited atop each story. Only stories authored by our Administrative Team contain official statements and positions of The Writing Cooperative.

Contribute to The Writing Cooperative.

Anyone who writes for The Writing Cooperative is welcome to join our global Slack community! Communicate with other writers, help each other edit drafts, collaborate, and more.

Join our free Slack community.

We frequently host writing challenges to encourage creativity and push people to write outside their comfortable genres. Entries are posted in Slack and winners are awarded prizes!

Check out our latest writing challenge.

Becoming a patron of The Writing Cooperative means you’ll help us not just stay alive, but thrive. In exchange for your support, we’re offering exclusive perks for different levels of patronage.

Support The Writing Cooperative.

Administrators

The four founders of The Writing Cooperative.

Jessica Jungton paints landscapes in portrait and smiles at strangers. Jessica manages our publishing and social media.

Justin Cox eats donuts and writes about them. Justin engages our community through Slack, Patreon, and email.

Sand Farnia walks through mindfields. Sand maintains our finances.

Stella J. McKenna is a mystery woman. Stella runs our writing challenges and manages publishing.

Contributors / Writers

Writers who contribute articles to The Writing Cooperative. Becoming a contributor is easy and free.

Followers

Our more than 150,000 people who currently follow our publication on Medium.

Medium Members

Paying members of Medium who can see the locked content in The Writing Cooperative publication.

Medium Partners

Contributors who join the Medium Partnership Program.

Patrons

Those who financially support The Writing Cooperative on Patreon. There are three levels of patrons: Fans, Supporters, Friends, and VIPs.

Slack Members

People who join our free Slack community.

VIP Patrons

Our biggest supporters on Patreon. We are grateful for their support and encourage you to follow them and support their work. (Names are listed based on how long they’ve been a patron, longest on top.)

  • Danny Forest
  • Thomas
  • Carla Paton
  • Heather Wargo
  • ak_finch
  • Elizabeth Coplan
  • Charlton Alexander
  • ProWritingAid
  • Sanju
  • Maureen Cooke
  • Stacie McCall Whitaker
  • Nabil Benali
  • Donna Barker 💜
  • KG
  • Valarie Marie
  • Maribeth Mooney
Thanks to Stella J. McKenna.

  • The Writing Cooperative
  • Community
  • About Us

  • Justin Cox 🍩

    Medium member since Mar 2017

    Co-founder and Editor of The Writing Cooperative ➡️ Subscribe and connect at http://JustinCox.com.

  • The Writing Cooperative

    Helping each other write better.
